articles.title: 'Oust Uncle': Thailand's jog for dissent signals new breed of activists
articles.description: Thai office worker Pinyo Tongleun, 33, once participated in "Yellow Shirt" protests against then-Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, who was eventually ousted in a military coup in 2014.
articles.content:
BANGKOK (Reuters) - Thai office worker Pinyo Tongleun, 33, once participated in “Yellow Shirt” protests against then-Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, who was eventually ousted in a military coup in 2014.

articles.author: Duncan Miriri
articles.title: Kenya's first green bond starts trading on the bourse
articles.description: Kenya's first green bond was listed for trading on the Nairobi Securities Exchange on Monday, offering investors the chance to put money into an environmentally-friendly fixed income security for the first time in the bourse's 65 year history.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UAE to double renewable energy portfolio in next 10 years - ADNOC
articles.description: The United Arab Emirates grew its renewable energy portfolio by more than 400% in the last 10 years, and is on track to double that again in the coming decade, Abu Dhabi National Oil Co. chief executive Sultan al-Jaber said on Monday.
articles.content:
ABU DHABI (Reuters) - The United Arab Emirates grew its renewable energy portfolio by more than 400% in the last 10 years, and is on track to double that again in the coming decade, Abu Dhabi National Oil Co. chief executive Sultan al-Jaber said on Monday.

articles.title: Defendant admits in court to killing Slovak journalist Kuciak
articles.description: Miroslav Marcek, one of four defendants in a trial related to the murder of Slovak journalist Jan Kuciak and his fiancee last year, admitted to the killing in court on Monday.
articles.content:
